articles.title: We may have spotted the first magnetar flare outside our galaxy - Ars Technica
articles.description: Not all gamma-ray bursts come from supernovae.
articles.content:
Enlarge/ M82, the site of what's likely to be a giant flare from a magnetar.

Gamma rays are a broad category of high-energy photons, including everything with more energy than an X-ray. While the… [+4522 chars]
